sourceMeaningMnemonic: You only got a <radical>few</radical> <radical>grain</radical>s on your plate. It only takes you a  <kanji>second</kanji> to eat them. It can't take any longer because there were so few.
meaningInfo: Count how many seconds it takes for you to eat the few grains you have. One... oh, they're gone.
readingMnemonic: And also, a <kanji>second</kanji> is how long it takes for your awful <reading>B.O.</reading> (<ja>びょう</ja>) to appear.
readingInfo: Whenever you eat a few grains, even if only for a second, you get a terrible reaction seconds later that causes some pretty terrible B.O.
